questionData.explanation_of_Question: 選項 B 是正確的，因為過去完成式 (had arrived) 用來描述在過去某個時間點 (By the time...) 之前已經完成的動作。選項 A 使用現在完成式不符語境；選項 C 使用現在式不符語境；選項 D 使用過去進行式也不符語境。

options.text: By the time I arrived at the station, the train has already left.
By the time I arrived at the station, the train had already left.
By the time I arrived at the station, the train already leaves.
By the time I arrived at the station, the train was already leaving.

questionData.question: Choose the correct sentence using past tenses.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 選項 A 是正確的，因為 'information' 是不可數名詞，不能用 'an' 或 'many' 修飾，且動詞應使用單數 'is'。選項 B 使用 'an information' 錯誤；選項 C 使用 'are' 錯誤；選項 D 使用 'many informations' 錯誤。

options.text: The information about the event is very useful.
An information about the event are very useful.
The information about the event are very useful.
Many informations about the event is very useful.

questionData.question: Which sentence has the correct subject-verb agreement and noun usage?

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 選項 C 是正確的，因為在最高級結構 'the + 最高級 + 名詞 + that + 主詞 + have ever + 過去分詞' 中，需要使用定冠詞 'the'。選項 A 缺少 'the' 且 'have' 應為 'has' (搭配 'she')；選項 B 缺少 'the'；選項 D 使用 'the' 但動詞形態錯誤。

options.text: This is best book that she have ever read.
This is best book that she has ever read.
This is the best book that she has ever read.
This is the best book that she ever read.

questionData.question: Select the sentence with the correct article and verb form.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 選項 D 是正確的，頻率副詞 'often' 通常放在助動詞 (will) 和主要動詞 (go) 之間。選項 A、B、C 的 'often' 位置都不正確。

options.text: They often will go to the cinema on Fridays.
Often they will go to the cinema on Fridays.
They will go often to the cinema on Fridays.
They will often go to the cinema on Fridays.

questionData.question: Choose the sentence with the correct word order.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 選項 B 是正確的，這是第三類條件句 (Third Conditional)，用於談論過去未發生的情況及其結果。結構為 'If + 過去完成式, would have + 過去分詞'。選項 A、C、D 的動詞時態組合都不正確。

options.text: If you had studied harder, you would pass the exam.
If you had studied harder, you would have passed the exam.
If you studied harder, you would have passed the exam.
If you study harder, you would have passed the exam.

questionData.question: Which sentence correctly uses the Third Conditional structure?
